summary.p: Wishes that Bullinger in Zurich would help him secure a position; is with the chancellor of Rötteln. Sends greetings to his cousin, Bullinger's wife, and requests that he write back to him promptly through the letter carrier.

div.p: My humble, obedient, willing service beforehand.
Highly learned, dear cousin, I want to let you know that I am fresh and healthy, praise be to God, etc.

Dear cousin, I kindly ask you, if it is ever possible, to help me with a position so that I may be with you, and also with my dear cousin; for I have a great longing for you and her. Furthermore, I want to let you know that I am in Rötteln with the chancellor.

Nothing more, except greet my dear cousin, your wife, for me. I also ask you, if it is possible for business reasons, to write to me about how you are doing, and also how my dear cousin is doing, and to send me such a letter through the carrier of this letter.
Dated Rötteln, in January, on Tuesday after the New Year, in the year 1536.
Your obedient cousin Hans Jakob Adlischwyler.
To the highly learned lord, Mr. Heinrich N., preacher in Zurich, to my dear cousin's hands.
